required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcome of Sub-inguinal Varicocelectomy on Normal Semen in Patients Complaining of Orchilagia With Normal Semen
clinical_study.official_title: the Effect of Sub-inguinal Varicocelectomy in Patients Complaining of Orchialgia With Normal Semen Analysis

brief_summary.textblock:
varicoclelectomy is done for subfertiltiy and varicocele induced orchialgia. The effect of varicocelectomy on semen analysis is controversial. Many articles report favorable outcomes and others do not.
Most study don't focus on varicocelectomy done for varicocele induced orchialgia,and those studies dont report on postoperative semen.
This study will focus on the effect of operation on the semen postoperatively .

primary_outcome.measure: Grades of Motility of sperm in semen analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Count of sperms in semen analysis

other_outcome.measure: Pain improvement using Numeric Pain Rating Scale

other_outcome.description: doppler will be done to evaluate the veins pre and postoperative

intervention.description: varicocele ligation done at the level of subinguinal region

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Primary varicocele.
2. Patient's age more than 20 years.
3. Scrotal pain (after exclusion of other causes).
4. Normal semen analysis
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Secondary varicocele.
2. Recurrent varicocele.

results_reference.citation: Cayan S, Shavakhabov S, Kadioğlu A. Treatment of palpable varicocele in infertile men: a meta-analysis to define the best technique. J Androl. 2009 Jan-Feb;30(1):33-40. doi: 10.2164/jandrol.108.005967. Epub 2008 Sep 4. Review.

Kupis Ł, Dobroński PA, Radziszewski P. Varicocele as a source of male infertility - current treatment techniques. Cent European J Urol. 2015;68(3):365-70. doi: 10.5173/ceju.2015.642. Epub 2015 Oct 15. Review.

Shabana W, Teleb M, Dawod T, Elsayed E, Desoky E, Shahin A, Eladl M, Sorour W. Predictors of improvement in semen parameters after varicocelectomy for male subfertility: A prospective study. Can Urol Assoc J. 2015 Sep-Oct;9(9-10):E579-82. doi: 10.5489/cuaj.2808. Epub 2015 Sep 9.
Paick S, Choi WS. Varicocele and Testicular Pain: A Review. World J Mens Health. 2019 Jan;37(1):4-11. doi: 10.5534/wjmh.170010. Epub 2018 May 16. Review.

Cho CL, Esteves SC, Agarwal A. Novel insights into the pathophysiology of varicocele and its association with reactive oxygen species and sperm DNA fragmentation. Asian J Androl. 2016 Mar-Apr;18(2):186-93. doi: 10.4103/1008-682X.170441. Review.
